December 05, 2014 Bringing the News to the Caribbean

We were brought in to create a game-changing news network, but eventually cast aside in favor of inhouse design and development teams.

Background

It’s not every day you get to design a product for entire countries like Jamaica and Haiti, so when Aggrego was brought in to design the digital news network, “Loop”, in Spring 2014, I was definitely excited. Digicel, a communications company that handles phones in the Carribean, wanted to capitalize on their significant involment in their customers’ lives by creating the ultimate source.

It’s not every day you get to design a product for entire countries like Jamaica and Haiti, so when Aggrego was brought in to design the digital news network, “Loop”, in Spring 2014, I was definitely excited. Digicel, a communications company that handles phones in the Carribean, wanted to capitalize on their significant involment in their customers’ lives by creating the ultimate source.

More Posts

I'm Josh Martin

I am a Designer, Illustrator, and Front-End Developer from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania living in Chicago, Illinois. I currently work as an independent product designer, focusing on web/app UI/UX and creative direction.

In my free time, I work on variety of side projects that reflect a number of personal interests. Feel free to check them out: Brood, Reveew, Alleyooop, Bbbench.

You can find updates on what I'm up to on Twitter, Dribbble and Instagram.

My unabridged portfolio can be found on Behance.

I have a storefront to buy digital resources. I hope to open one for prints soon.

If you are interested in seeing a more detailed look into my background, such as past jobs, and program/design proficiencies, please see my CV.

You can reach me at hellojoshmartin@gmail.com.
